Please start meta layer specific changes with the following: meta-asus: <intro msg>.

Also, please leave an empty line between your first intro line and the body of the commit msg.
Please also limit your maximum chars to 72 in the body of the commit msg
I'm not sure that this is useful; all code goes against master branch.  There isn't a v2.16 yet anyhow.
Please fix your git-config.
Hi Kelly, welcome to OpenBMC. I see you are on the ASUS CLA so I also added you to the gerrit group.
I don't think we need new README files like this.  The ones that are there are a left-over from when we had separate repositories for meta-layers.
I would suggest dropping this 'obmc_' from your meta name.
Please keep this to `nanbield scarthgap` like the rest of the layers.

This should be handled by phosphor-defaults.inc now.  Don't put this in local.conf files.

Without comments I don't even know if this is the default password or your own password.  You shouldn't submit custom passwords to the public repository.
Don't duplicate these.  They're already in image_types_phosphor.bbclass.
GBMC?

I don't think we should have this.  What are you trying to accomplish with this?

You don't need all the extra spaces at least.
Please don't put this stuff into the public repository.

You have duplicates of all the files in `templates/default`.  I already reviewed them in the previous location but it seems like this is due to a Yocto upgrade.  We should only have one copy of these files.  Please apply the feedback I already gave in the other files in `templates/default` also.

Lots of patch files in this commit. They are not allowed, here's the CI fail due to them:

10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk/0001-u-boot-ESPI-OOB-channel-ready.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk/0002-u-boot-adjust-dts-for-X4TF.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk/0003-u-boot-default-config-and-disable-EMMC-Boot.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk/0004-u-boot-board-and-pinctl-init.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk/0005-u-boot-scu-spi-init.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk/0006-u-boot-net-init.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-bsp/u-boot/u-boot-aspeed-sdk/0007-u-boot-save-default-env.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-kernel/linux/linux-aspeed/0001-linux-aspeed-add-dts-config.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-kernel/linux/linux-aspeed/0002-linux-aspeed-clock-init.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-kernel/linux/linux-aspeed/0003-linux-aspeed-init-8250-serial-and-udma.patch
10:48:47 meta-asus/meta-obmc_x4tf/recipes-kernel/linux/linux-aspeed/0004-linux-aspeed-support-winbond-w25q01jvsfim.patch

10:48:47 Patches are not allowed on OpenBMC in these layers.  Please upstream your changes and see     https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/meta-layer-guidelines.md
Don't overwrite the SRCREV.
What did this accomplish?

Please don't supply your own full re-config of the kernel.  FInd the minimal options you need to have added and add those as a small config snippet.  Otherwise, rely on the defconfig we already have for linux-aspeed.
You shouldn't need this kind of patch anyways now.  Linux now uses the JEDEDC info from the SPI-NOR to interact with it.
I don't know why you'd need `ipmi_si`.  Isn't that used for host kernels?
Please don't add these.
Not sure what this accomplished?
Please don't add these.
What were you accomplishing with this?
